MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Recap of Episode 1.
In this unusual situation of being suspended from an ice wall, I remembered that our purpose was to investigate the giant creature that has been appearing in the snowfields.
This is the end of the recollection of events. Leipzig lets out a sigh as she looks at me with concern, shivering from the blizzard that has robbed us of our body heat.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Leipzig
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: The more unpleasant the prediction, the more it comes true. I am ashamed of my ignorance, and I am very sorry that I have put you in danger.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Leipzig
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: It's my job to protect you, Your Lordship.
Don't be so hard on yourself, Leipzig. We're both lucky not to have lost our lives. We are literally walking a tightrope, but we will get back on track.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Leipzig
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Yes, sir. But I'm still puzzled. What the hell is going on?
I believe we were investigating a place where a giant creature is often seen.

That's right―We took the train to the site,
got off and examined the surrounding land with the survey equipment we brought.
The snow-covered ground unexpectedly rose, and because of that, we lost our balance and fell... Then, I guess I was passed out until just now.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Leipzig
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: It seems that you fell, hit your head pretty bad, and immediately fainted.
I screwed up. It's a lack of training. If I'd been able to take it as quickly as possible, I would have been able to stay conscious.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Leipzig
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: It wouldn't have helped, it was so sudden. Besides, Your Lordship was more concerned about me than yourself, and gave me a hand when I was about to fall as well.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Leipzig
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Because of that, you lost your balance and fell down without being able to catch yourself. In other words, the entire blame lies with me. This is a major blunder that can't be solved with a pay cut or a letter of apology.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Leipzig
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
However, it's fine that your kind, but if possible, from now on,
your first priority should be to protect yourself, not me, your subordinate.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Leipzig
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I'm merely a replaceable cog.
Unlike you, the heart of the circuit, I'm expendable.
Please don't say such a thing. I wonder if some soldiers are so obsessed with accomplishing their missions that they tend to despise themselves.
Each and every one of the members of the SSS is an important and precious human being living in this world. I don't like the idea of any of you throwing away your lives.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Leipzig
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: A cog has joys, too. Just keep in mind, sir. I don't mean to take life for granted, but I'm only doing my best to achieve the ultimate goal.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Leipzig
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: More importantly, now is not the time for idle chatter. It would be no laughing matter if you lost your life accidentally while preaching the importance of life.

That's true. But really, what is this situation... Did we get kidnapped by a huge bird or something and thrown out on the hillside of a high mountain? Or did we slide down the slope of the mountain and arrive at our present point?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Leipzig
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: No, sir. I've got a guess...

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Leipzig
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I think that the ice wall we see in front of us may be the mysterious giant creature we've been investigating...

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Leipzig
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I don't know if you've noticed,
but this wall seems to be moving constantly, though subtly this whole time.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Leipzig
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
If you listen carefully, you can feel its heartbeat.
This is a mysterious creature, huge as a mountain.

I see. If I think about it that way, a lot of things match up.
Perhaps this monster usually mimics the snow-covered earth and remains motionless.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Leipzig
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Exactly. There were no tracks in the area because it didn't move.

And I'm sure that feces and other wastes are also dripping deep into its giant body, deep into the ground. Even so, we may be able to recognize them if we observe them carefully based on that premise.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Leipzig
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Yes, sir. But this area is always swirling with fierce blizzards. Most of the traces will be wiped out by it, and the terrain will change with every passing snowfall.
That's why it's hard to notice the existence of this thing that mimics the terrain itself. The bigger the lie, the harder it is to figure out.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Leipzig
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: We were bamboozled. And it's a good thing, because every time an animal or other creature passes over it without noticing, it rises up and...

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Leipzig
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: That's how it gets people and animals to fall and devours its doomed prey.

It doesn't have to constantly exercise and burn calories, it just waits and the nutrition will come to it. Based on the principle of efficiency or survival of the fittest, I guess that's how these creatures evolved.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Leipzig
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Exactly.
Living things are much more efficient and functional than machines.
Are we like ticks or fleas, sticking to the skin of such a huge creature?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Leipzig
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Yeah. That's a good point.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Leipzig
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I'll dig my ice axe, which I brought with me just in case, into the skin of this ice wall-like creature, and I'll keep us in place to prevent us from falling.
Continue to Episode 3
